com.paypal.selion.platform.html.support

Class HtmlElementUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paypal.selion.platform.html.support.HtmlElementUtils

  • public class HtmlElementUtils
extends Object
    HtmlElementUtils houses utilities related to HTML element locators.

    • Method Detail

      • locateElement

        public static org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebElement locateElement(String locator)
        Parses locator string to identify the proper By subclass before calling Selenium WebElement.findElement(By) to locate the web element.
        Parameters:
        locator - A String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        Returns:
        RemoteWebElement that represents the html element that was located using the locator provided.

      • locateElement

        public static org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebElement locateElement(String locator,
                                                        ParentTraits parent)
        Parses locator string to identify the proper By subclass before calling Selenium WebElement.findElement(By) to locate the web element nested within the parent web element.
        Parameters:
        locator - String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        parent - ParentTraits object that represents the parent element for this element.
        Returns:
        RemoteWebElement that represents the html element that was located using the locator provided.

      • locateElements

        public static List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> locateElements(String locator)
        Parses locator string to identify the proper By subclass before calling Selenium WebElement.findElements(By) to locate the web elements.
        Parameters:
        locator - String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        Returns:
        WebElement list that represents the html elements that was located using the locator provided.

      • locateElements

        public static List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> locateElements(String locator,
                                                  ParentTraits parent)
        Parses locator string to identify the proper By subclass before calling Selenium WebElement.findElements(By) to locate the web elements nested within the parent web .
        Parameters:
        locator - String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        parent - ParentTraits object that represents the parent element for this element.
        Returns:
        WebElement list that represents the html elements that was located using the locator provided.

      • isValidXpath

        public static void isValidXpath(String locator)
        Validates a child locator to have the xpath dot notation.
        Parameters:
        locator - String that represents the xpath locator for an element.

      • resolveByType

        public static org.openqa.selenium.By resolveByType(String locator)
        Method to split the locator string with delimiter '|' to return a valid By type.
        Parameters:
        locator - String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        Returns:
        By object that represents the actual locating strategy that would be employed.

      • getFindElementType

        public static org.openqa.selenium.By getFindElementType(String locator)
        Detects Selenium By type depending on what the locator string starts with.
        Parameters:
        locator - String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        Returns:
        By sub-class that represents the actual location strategy that will be used.

      • isElementPresent

        public static boolean isElementPresent(String locator)
        Checks if the provided element is present on the page based on the locator provided
        Parameters:
        locator - String that represents the means to locate this element (could be id/name/xpath/css locator).
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the element was found.
